questions.question: Test cricket is the longest format of international cricket recognized by the ICC.
ODI cricket matches consist of 40 overs per side.
T20 International matches have a maximum of 20 overs per team.
The ICC World Test Championship is held every two years.
In ODI cricket, each bowler can bowl a maximum of 10 overs.
Test matches can last up to 5 days with 6 hours of play per day.
The ICC T20 World Cup is held every four years.
In Test cricket, there is no limit to the number of overs a bowler can bowl in an innings.
ODI cricket uses two new balls, one from each end, throughout the innings.
T20 cricket allows for a maximum of 4 fielders outside the 30-yard circle during non-powerplay overs.
